availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Winn (Clark County, Kentucky, attorney and banker)

body.p: Clark County, Kentucky, attorney . Kentucky native. Son of Jesse D. Winn. Married to Sarah E. Winn. Father of John G. Winn and Mary E. Winn. Attended school in Clark County, Kentucky, in 1850. Attorney in Clark County in 1860. Household owned five enslaved persons in Clark County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 232B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, Winchester District 2, p. 872.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, Winchester District 2, p. 346B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, Mount Sterling, p. 307A.
"William Henry Winn (1836-1884)," Find A Grave, Memorial 84927057, accessed July 17, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/84927057.
